title: Linear Inequalities and Number Line Graphs

vocab.definition: A mathematical statement comparing two expressions
A symbol (>) showing one number is larger than another
A symbol (<) showing one number is smaller than another
All values that make an inequality true
A visual representation of numbers or data

teachingNotes: Use number lines to show solutions. Practice with real-world inequality situations like age limits or temperature ranges.

sample.question: What is a mathematical statement comparing two expressions?

multiplechoice.question: Which inequality means x is at least 5?
expectedAny: x greater than or equal to 5

fillintheblank.question: All values that make an inequality true form the ________ set.

wordProblems.question: You need at least $20 to buy a game. You have $8. How much more money do you need?
